title: Comment on “Improving the efficiency of a CIGS solar cell to above 31% with Sb2S3 as a new BSF: a numerical simulation approach by SCAPS-1D” by M. F. Rahman and S. Goumri-Said et al., RSC Adv., 2024, 14, 1924
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,31655-31656
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA03002H, Comment
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Alexander P. Kirk
In this Comment, the detailed balance-limiting open circuit voltage, fill factor, and power conversion efficiency are calculated for a 1.1 eV bandgap copper indium gallium selenide (CIGS) solar cell at 300 K when irradiated by the air mass 1.5 global (AM1.5G) spectrum.
